title: Reporting a player for being new???
body:
Greetings and Salutations!, soooooooo, im like super new and this game is super fun, but i had a kinda amusing encounter with some persons in game. Today, or just now, and not whinein' or nothin, but appearently some person was all kinds of unhappy and wanted to "report me cause I didn't know how to play the game".... in intro. Soooo, the person was like, level 20 somethin and  im like 7,and im all, why is he all kinds of upset?
 Im not worried or nothin' i think it's kinda all kinds of silly. 
But, what do you all think, is that ridiculous or is it my fault for bein' new??

replies.body:
Nah, it's ridiculous silliness.
Reports like that hold about as much weight as an anchor made of featherdusters.

If/when you meet someone like that you're better off muting them, 'cause they'll try their very best to ruin your mood.  If you hold tab in-game and click that little speaker beside their champ their chat will disappear.  Some people just like livin' while sitting on cacti.
Everyone whos replied, I love you

Thank you :) I'm happy to reply and talk with new players, and I'm happy that you've added me. It's great to have another person to fight alongside.

I'm sure you'll be a great player before you know it.

people are a bunch of whiney bitches on the game and think if you are new or less skilled then them you have no right to play but they dont remember when they were in the same situation. 

just ignore the hate, legit try to learn the game and have fun. 

if you are flamed just report them , dont flame back (cuz that can get you punished) and move along

Thank you!!
  I just started like, two days ago and I am working on learning, thanks for being amazing and replying, i knew they were being silly, buut, i just wanted to make sure.  <3
If you want you can add me in case you have any questions you want to ask, or if you want to play some games. My name in game is the same here.

It is only a valid complaint if you are in either ranked mode and don't know what your doing, in bots or normals? mess up make mistakes, but do learn from them. Watch videos about your specific role or champion because once you master fully one champion the skills all apply to most other champions in some way.

In short focus on quality first, then quantity.

Some people seem to think there's no such things as new players in league  (they assume all low level accounts are smurfs) so when they see someone not playing well they assume they're trolling. Don't mind them they're idiots.

If you got any questions about the game feel free to add me.

1. their behavior is never okay
2. ignore it and report them end of game (threatening to report is reportable btw)
3. why are they 20 and still playing intro? they have no right to trash talk anyone's skill if thats the lvl they like to play
4.welcome to league :)

It's ridiculous. I'm nearly level thirty and still play like someone who's only been playing for a few weeks. I'm glad you're not worried, though. And if you need someone to play with, send me a friend request. I'd be up for playing with you.

Hey there! Welcome to LOL. The behavior you received from that person is just a start. I do not want to scare you or anything but every other game you might have someone who thinks he is a god at this game and everyone else is a noob. In that case you should do one or both of these things.
1) Just smile at their silliness and move on, let them rabble.
2) Mute them. It is the single best facility this game has. U can type /mute (player name) to mute them. It will be as if they do not exist in chat.
Later on in the game when you are playing ranked, people like these will come in bulk, a part of learning league is to learn how to handle them as well. Stay positive at all times
Hope it helped. Good luck on the rift.
